summary.para: The different states that a message can be in.

remarks.para: A message object transitions through a set of states as it is being received or sent (or read or written).

summary.para: The initial state after a message has been created. In this state, there is no content in the message, and neither the header nor the body can be accessed.
The message headers have been initialized, and can be accessed, but the body cannot be accessed. This state is used to build up all the headers prior to writing/sending them.
The body of the message is being read, for example when a message is received. In this state, the headers can be accessed, and the body can be read (see or ).
The body of the message is being written, for example when a message is being sent. In this state, the headers can be accessed, and the body can be written (see or ).
The message body has been read or written (the end of the body has been read or written). The headers can still be accessed.
